resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
kszucs opened a new pull request #2085: ARROW-2638: [Python] Prevent calling extension class constructors directly
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2085
 
 
   Using http://docs.cython.org/en/latest/src/userguide/extension_types.html#fast-instantiation
   
   What do You think @pitrou ? Should I implement for the rest of the classes? (Field, Schema etc.)

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on a change in pull request #2085: ARROW-2638: [Python] Prevent calling extension class constructors directly
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2085#discussion_r191049112
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/tests/test_schema.py
 ##########
 @@ -23,6 +23,13 @@
 import pyarrow as pa
 
 
+def test_schema_constructor_errors():
+    with pytest.raises(ReferenceError):
+        repr(pa.Schema())
 
 Review comment:
   I know you are just moving those tests around, but I wonder why `repr()` needs to be called here. Shouldn't the constructor itself raise an error?

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

pitrou commented on a change in pull request #2085: ARROW-2638: [Python] Prevent calling extension class constructors directly
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2085#discussion_r191049125
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/table.pxi
 ##########
 @@ -565,6 +565,10 @@ cdef class RecordBatch:
         self.batch = NULL
         self._schema = None
 
+    def __init__(self):
+        raise RuntimeError("Do not call RecordBatch's constructor directly, "
 
 Review comment:
   I would raise `TypeError`, not `RuntimeError`.

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/table.pxi

         self.batch = NULL
         self._schema = None
 
+    def __init__(self):
+        raise RuntimeError("Do not call RecordBatch's constructor directly, "
+                           "use one of the `from_*` methods instead.")
 
 Review comment:
   Nit: they are not methods but functions. Or perhaps there are both, so say "methods and functions".

kszucs commented on issue #2085: ARROW-2638: [Python] Prevent calling extension class constructors directly
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2085#issuecomment-392264768
 
 
   @pitrou Pickling isn't working after Implementing it for DataTypes. How about removing `__getstate__` and `__setstate__` methods and use `__reduce__` with the appropiate factory functions (`type_for_alias`, `decimal128` etc.)?

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2085#issuecomment-392264768
 
 
   @pitrou Pickling doesn't work after Implementing it for DataTypes. How about removing `__getstate__` and `__setstate__` methods and use `__reduce__` with the appropiate factory functions (`type_for_alias`, `decimal128` etc.) instead? Would it cause compatibility issues?

pitrou commented on issue #2085: ARROW-2638: [Python] Prevent calling extension class constructors directly
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2085#issuecomment-392265438
 
 
   Using `__reduce__` is fine with me. We may be breaking binary pickle compatibility with previous versions, but at this point I think it's not a problem.

----------------------------------------------------------------

xhochy commented on issue #2085: ARROW-2638: [Python] Prevent calling extension class constructors directly
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2085#issuecomment-392265733
 
 
   > Using __reduce__ is fine with me. We may be breaking binary pickle compatibility with previous versions, but at this point I think it's not a problem.
   
   I would not take this at the moment as a concern. Pickling in old releases was quite broken. Master is behaving much better now.

----------------------------------------------------------------

kszucs commented on issue #2085: ARROW-2638: [Python] Prevent calling extension class constructors directly
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2085#issuecomment-392271127
 
 
   Are the `_check_nullptr` methods still required? It looks like the only possible way the class can be in uninitialized state was calling the constructors, but that's prevented now.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: However docstrings are warning about it, I can instantiate these classes which IMHO should be explicitly disallowed.
fields.summary: [Python] Prevent calling extension class constructors directly

comments.body: Another possibility is to simply make it valid to call them, at least in the non-ambiguous cases.
